task_description: Add comprehensive risk assessment table to Section IV.E (340B Drug Pricing Program Compliance)

changes_made.action: Enhanced existing risk assessment table in Section C with comprehensive analysis
changes_made.impact: REPLACE simplified 5-row risk table with comprehensive table including detailed methodologies, aggregate exposure calculations, and P10/P50/P90 scenario analysis

findings.description: Loss of 340B savings due to manufacturer contract pharmacy restrictions
findings.methodology: NPV at 8% discount rate; $3M-$5M annual loss × 6.71 annuity factor
findings.basis: Federal litigation precedent (Sanofi 3d Cir., Becerra D.C. Cir.); Ohio lacks state law protection

findings.description: DSH percentage decline below 11.75% statutory threshold
findings.basis: Current 28% utilization provides 16.25-point cushion; for-profit conversions reduce Medicaid 3-8%
2023 Ohio Medicaid audit clean; JG/TB modifiers best practice; manufacturer audits more stringent
$28M volume; 8 contract pharmacies; manufacturer enforcement priorities
FY2023 HRSA statistics: 51% of audits had OPAIS issues; 5-7 year audit rotation

scenario_analysis.p10_optimistic: $0 (manufacturer restrictions overturned; no Medicaid decline; clean audits)
scenario_analysis.p50_base_case: $32M NPV manufacturer restrictions + $6M EV DSH + $437.5K EV audit = $38.4M total weighted

dollar_quantification.requirement: All findings include dollar ranges with methodology
dollar_quantification.notes: All 5 findings include NPV/EV calculations with 8% discount rate, probability weighting, and calculation methodology

probability_basis.notes: All probabilities cite specific basis: federal court precedent, HRSA FY2023 audit statistics, industry data, expert judgment

mitigation_specificity.notes: All findings include actionable mitigation: contract provisions (escrow, indemnity), operational actions (monitoring, internal audits), policy changes

risk_coverage.requirement: Cover all 340B compliance risks identified in section
risk_coverage.notes: Table covers: manufacturer restrictions (B.1), DSH eligibility (B.2), duplicate discounts (B.3), manufacturer audits (B.4), HRSA audits (B.4)

subsections_used: B.1: Loss of 340B Savings Due to Manufacturer Contract Pharmacy Restrictions (lines 63-111)
B.2: Risk of Program Ineligibility Due to DSH Percentage Decline (lines 112-157)
B.4: Manufacturer and HRSA Audit Risk (lines 208-262)
references_verified: Sanofi Aventis v. HHS, 58 F.4th 696 (3d Cir. 2023)
Loper Bright v. Raimondo, 144 S. Ct. 2244 (2024)

verification_checks.criterion: Dollar amounts for 340B savings at risk
verification_checks.actual: $12M total with $3M-$5M at risk from restrictions

verification_checks.criterion: Probabilities based on HRSA enforcement precedent
verification_checks.expected: Cite HRSA statistics or federal precedent
verification_checks.actual: HRSA FY2023 audit statistics (51% OPAIS issues, 25% violations); Third/D.C. Circuit precedent
$5M escrow, DSH monitoring covenant, patient eligibility policy review, OPAIS verification

integration_notes.reason: Risk Assessment already exists as Section C; this is an ENHANCEMENT/REPLACEMENT of existing content

recommendations_for_integration: REPLACE existing risk table at Section C (lines 268-277) with comprehensive enhanced version
Verify aggregate exposure calculations align with risk-summary.json
Ensure scenario analysis P10/P50/P90 drivers are consistent with Section E (Recommendations)
Cross-check mitigation provisions against draft contract language in Section E.2
Validate that Sensitivity Drivers in scenario analysis reference correct legal precedents

task_notes.discrepancy_noted: Task ID W2-006 in user instruction targets Section IV.E (340B), but remediation-dispatch.md shows W2-006 assigned to Section IV.D (GME). User instruction clearly specifies section-IV-E-340b.md as target, so proceeding with IV.E as intended. Possible dispatch numbering error or user override.
task_notes.enhancement_vs_insertion: Original section-IV-E-340b.md ALREADY contains a risk assessment table at Section C (lines 268-277). This task ENHANCES the existing table with comprehensive detail rather than pure insertion.
tier_3_enhancements_included: P10/P50/P90 scenario analysis with optimistic/base/stress cases
Sensitivity drivers with specific probability impacts
Aggregate exposure table with gross/weighted/escrow/price adjustment
Detailed probability methodologies citing specific sources
